body: FYI .rst are the sources in ReST format :)

@TryHarder01 Search for the PR number #3643 in the CHANGELOG.

Looks like this fix has been reverted in the latest superset. >22.0. The logic that moved the query to sql alchemy is now back in pandas sans raw_connection which causes a problem with the '%' character again.

Hi...
In Add Slice button in Slices Tab, I can find an option "Choose a datasource" 
In this option, I want to display only the datasources that the user has access to.
(Right now all datasources are visible there..But on clicking the datasource that the user has no access gives error message..Here the user has gamma role)..How can I hide the other datasources in this option..
Which permission is to be removed...I tried it..But can't find the solution...
Is there any option for restricting user from viewing other tables.??
Thanks in Advance...

You should use yarn to build superset as documented. Works fine for me here: 

```
yarn run build
yarn run v1.3.2
$ NODE_ENV=production webpack --colors --progress
Hash: ca925a504a067dea7f36                                                                
Version: webpack 3.10.0
Time: 104775ms
```
Please next time just force push the branch instead of opening a new PR. And please fix the build.
Dup of #3829, please close.
Will do. Thanks!
I'm having the same issue. Is this still being worked on?

`yarn run build` versus `yarn run prod` seems to have done the trick.
  I should read the docs a little bit more :)

I created this PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/3885 which solves the issue. Its uses plain SQL, I haven't updated it to use alembic as described by @john-bodley above. Should I do that or does it look ok to merge as is?

I don't know that we want to automatically reset the lag time (even if the number of days they set the lag to is not available) because it would make the data shown not what the user expected. What about showing a better error message (The time lag set at 361 days exceeds the length of data at 360 days. Please reduce the time lag)?

This is happening to me as well, although not after changing the SECRET_KEY.  I've upgraded to python 3.4, and now trying to access Sources -> Databases gives me the same error.  Perhaps python2 did not store whatever it needs to as utf-8?

The aim of superset is being code free but being open source you can do whatever you want.
@jevanio unrelated to this PR please use the mailing list or gitter.
@xrmx Do you have any example of using Python code for data manipulation and visualization?

Check out `viz.py` and look around for `df` (pandas dataframe) variables, they're everywhere. We tend to python for crunching (interacting with datastores, preparing the right JSON for the frontend) and Javascript for visualization.
That means you haven't installed the required python driver for MSSQL

In comparing a diff of the HTML provided by @rumbin, two things are apparent:
(1) The height of the slice_container changes from 65px down to 56.15px.  (Why?)
(2) The 20.5 version is using an iframe whose srcdoc appears to contain double quotes that are not escaped.  The srcdoc has a double quote before and after the html start and end tags, but all the code in between is also using double quotes.   Seems like all those should either be changed to single quotes, or escaped via & quot ; , right?

@mistercrunch - I like the idea of adding more grain (which would provide more flexibility in positioning and better viewability), but it does not seem that would address the root of this problem which is that even if there is enough space to show the text, it gets clipped.
Hey, @xrmx maybe you can close this issue if @petter-memrise has been unable to reproduce the issue?
Got you point , thank you so much!
@graceguo-supercat it's the exact same JSON endpoint as before so it should be ok

We use `AUTH_TYPE = AUTH_REMOTE_USER` for authentication, and [set REMOTE_USER](https://github.com/wikimedia/puppet/blob/production/modules/superset/templates/superset.wikimedia.org.erb#L21-L34) to the authenticated LDAP user's shell username via Apache mod_ldap in front of superset.  I'd like for folks that authenticate this way to be able to run hive queries as their own user.

2 questions:

- Why check `'auth' in url.query.keys()` when deciding whether or not to set this.  If `impersonate_user and username is not None`, shouldn't that be enough?  I have to configure my Hive database connection with `?auth=NONE` to get this to work. (To do so I also annoyingly have to specify a database in the URI, as `hostname:10000?auth=NONE` seems to try and parse the full `10000?auth=NONE` as the integer port for the URI.)

- When I do set `?auth=NONE` in the URI, testing the database connection seems fine.  But, saving the database connection fails with: `__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'hive_server2_proxy_user'`, and fails to save the change.  Upon saving, I see `INFO:root:Database.get_sqla_engine(). Masked URL: hive://hostname:10000/default?auth=NONE&hive_server2_proxy_user=otto` in the superset logs, which I think looks mostly good, buuuut, where are those underscores coming from?  The code explicitly sets `configuration['hive.server2.proxy.user']`, so something must be inserting them.

BTW, I've also tried to save the URI as `hive://hostname:10000/default?hive.server2.proxy.user=otto`, just to see if that works, but it gives the similar error message of `__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'hive.server2.proxy.user'
` with `INFO:root:Database.get_sqla_engine(). Masked URL: hive://hostname:10000/default?hive.server2.proxy.user=otto` in the superset logs
Addressed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/4163
lgtm

Users can use the `pip -e` option to install superset, no need to change this file.
```
git clone https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset.git
pip install -e incubator-superset
superset runserver -d
```
@zhaoyongjie oh really? Don't know pip has such a flag, thanks!
Does superset crash? What's wrong with the current type returned?
Looks like something that is handled in sqlalchemy

Opened PR here:
https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/pull/414
I have the same issue, @asdf2014 have you fixed it?

Yes sorry I forgot to add the error. It see the results as just one column of data. 
```
2018-01-10 10:16:00,075:ERROR:root:Shape of passed values is (1, 100), indices imply (20, 100)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/projects/incubator-superset/superset/views/core.py", line 2191, in sql_json
    query_id=query_id, return_results=True)
  File "/ss_python_venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/local.py", line 191, in __call__

  File "/ss_python_venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/app/task.py", line 380, in __call__

    return create_block_manager_from_blocks([values], [columns, index])
  File "/ss_python_venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pandas/core/internals.py", line 4303, in create_block_manager_from_blocks
```

Note that it's pretty tricky to write code that works across all DBAPIs. The spec itself isn't super formal on certain things and implementations diverge from the spec pretty often. SQLAlchemy doesn't always succeed at lining things up either.

To deal with this we have the `db_engine_spec` module to try and align everything. 

What does your connection string look like? Which db engine is this?

1. It'd be somewhat possible to implement this. One little challenge is that your pie chart may be a set of metrics with no dimension (filters shouldn't work), or one dimension and one metric (should work here). That'd be pretty easy to do as the dashboard controller already supports filtering (but only Table and Filter Box viz implement it)
2. Isn't this exactly what the Filter Box does?
3. There's a checkbox on the Table viz to add a full-text search
4. Word cloud could be altered to cast filtering event (much like Table does)
5. Not sure what you mean here, but most visualization offer a way to limit results, and there's an envrionment setting as a higher level limit.

Thanks for the quick response  @mistercrunch , I really appreciate it. There are somethings I couldn't explain correctly , so here is my output to your answers. thanks.
1. I am actually using one dimension one metric in pie chart, How can I make controller perform this type of filtering.
2. Actually when we add filter box, we define some filterable column (like: gender). I am having more than 10 filterable columns, I don't want to add 10 filter slices, I want a generic filter where first I choose which column I want and then it automatically adds one filter using that column.
3. Sorry my bad, search box is actually there. There is but one concern, it doesn't highlight searched text.
4. And how is that possible.
5. Like in word cloud I want only 20 top frequent words every time , if I apply filter than also top 20 top frequent words from filtered table.(unable to do it using where and having).
Doesn't seems like the CI failed due to my code modifications ... is there any way to build?
Isn't there a backtrace or something in the logs?

https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/pull/414

Sorry i don't found the other issue, perhaps because the status is closed.

@mistercrunch @xrmx  is there something you would like me to tackle on this?  It feels like a moderately bigger challenge as this would need to be abstracted out. Thoughts?

 engine = database.get_sqla_engine(
            schema=query.schema,
            nullpool=not ctask.request.called_directly,
            user_name=user_name,

        conn = engine.raw_connection()
        cursor = conn.cursor()

1. here's how the table viz does it https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/assets/visualizations/table.js#L137
2. isn't that what filter box does? you can pick many dimensions and you'll get one dropdown per dimension
3. sounds more like a nice to have than a concern to me
5. mmh, sounds like you may have to use some subquery in the Custom WHERE clause across many slices where you want your top 20

Regarding the misunderstanding on No.2:

I understand that @kartikgill does not want to have a huge filter slice with many drop-downs but only a small one with maybe 2 of them, where the first one serves as selector for the dimension to be filterable in the second drop-down.

In other words, the first one would be a filter for the dimensions to be filtered on.

Right?
@mistercrunch anything holding this back? It is an error in the Druid interface (and will not just affect MapBox).
